title: Handle `fn` parameter type with named borrow missing a leading `'`

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
Appropriately handle encountering an `fn` parameter type that has a named borrow missing a leading `'`:

```rust
fn foo<'x>(_: &x i32) {}
```

[We currently spam multiple errors for this](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=18c695ded8bfa7f71b5f6b2a39da860f):

```
error: expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`, found `)`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:21
  |
1 | fn foo<'x>(_: &x i32) {}
  |                     ^ expected one of `:`, `@`, or `|`
  |
  = note: anonymous parameters are removed in the 2018 edition (see RFC 1685)
help: if this is a parameter name, give it a type
  |
1 | fn foo<'x>(_: &x i32: TypeName) {}
  |                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
help: if this is a type, explicitly ignore the parameter name
  |
1 | fn foo<'x>(_: &x _: i32) {}
  |                  ^^^^^^

error: expected one of `!`, `(`, `)`, `,`, `::`, or `<`, found `i32`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:18
  |
1 | fn foo<'x>(_: &x i32) {}
  |                 -^^^ expected one of `!`, `(`, `)`, `,`, `::`, or `<`
  |                 |
  |                 help: missing `,`

error[E0412]: cannot find type `x` in this scope
 --> src/lib.rs:1:16
  |
1 | fn foo<'x>(_: &x i32) {}
  |                ^ not found in this scope
```
